description.narrative: to increase access to inclusive vocational programs to children and youth with disabilities

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).

description.narrative: Indicator 1.1: Cooperation Scheme of special schools and ICTA has been established Indicator 1.2: Curriculum is adjusted to the needs of youth with disabilities and implemented Indicator 1.3: Access of unemployed adults and youth with disabilities to vocational education on traditional arts and crafts have been established Indicator 1.4: Training of trainers-instructors (ToT) in order to prepare them for inclusive vocational education is organized Indicator 1.5: The skills and employability of the graduates of the traditional arts and crafts program are increased Indicator 1.6: Awareness on EU best practice in inclusive education is increased

comment.narrative: Baseline 1.1: There is no cooperation of ICTA and special schools Baseline 1.3: There is no modern curricula in ICTA Baseline 1.4: There is no access to VE on tradition arts and crafts for unemployed youth with disabilities

1) To establish the working team which will be responsible for the project implementation 2) To run Needs Assessment in pilot special and mainstream schools among students with disabilities, their parents, students without disabilities and graduates 3) To identify the target groups of students with and without disabilities 4) Based on the results of collaboration to identify the roles and responsibilities of all the stakeholders of the project. 5) To adjust two curricula to inclusive vocational program 6) To develop five-day training program for creation of inclusive environment 7) To develop and distribute booklets on inclusive education among students 8) To develop Individual –Development Plan (IDP) Template 9) To purchase necessary equipment and supplies for inclusive vocational program 10) To assign the Quality assurance team experts 11) To organize observations and monitoring of classrooms activities 12) To enrol students with and without disabilities to inclusive vocational arts and crafts program 13) To develop ToT program for teachers, special educators and special services providers 14) To recruit teacher assistant – interns – special educators 15) To recruit special services providers responsible to provide rehabilitation services to beneficiaries 16) To recruit arts and crafts teachers who will participate in curricula development and piloting of educational program 17) To organize trainings for teachers, teacher assistants and special services providers 18) Split of beneficiaries into 6 month and one year groups in 4 directions and start of educational program 19) To organize additional skills trainings for beneficiaries of the project

1) Four experts – members of the project working team have been recruited 2) -Needs Assessment is implemented (interviews and focus groups) -Final report is approved by the working team 3) Students with the following disabilities were identified as the target group of the project: - Students with hearing impairment - Students with Cerebral palsy - Students with mental and development delay Students with Down syndrome and Autistic Spectrum Disorder Students without disabilities studying at vocational schools and lyceums constituted the main target group to enrol 4) The draft version of joint action plan with clear identification of roles and responsibilities of all stakeholders is developed 5) 6-month and one-year curricula and teaching programs on Pottery crafts and Woodcrafts have been developed 6) The training program contributing to creation of inclusive environment in the classroom is developed 7) The booklets are developed and distributed among the first cohort of students enrolled in September 8) IDP template is developed and piloted with the first cohort of students 9) All the required equipment and supplies have been purchased on time 10) Quality Assurance is implemented by International consultant and two curriculum experts 11) International Consultant and two local curriculum experts completed observations and monitoring of curricula application and classroom activities and submitted reports 12) - 45 students with disabilities have been invited to participate in inclusive program -70 students without disabilities have been invited to participate in inclusive program 13) Training modules on inclusive education, disability awareness, innovative teaching methods, presentation skills have been developed by international and local experts 14) 10 students of Azerbaijan State Pedagogical University have been interviewed and recruited to participate as teacher assistants in the project 15) three psychologists, one sign language translator, one social worker and one speech therapist have been recruited 16) 6 experts, producers of souvenirs have been hired for the project 17) Trainings covering topics specified in 4.1.2 results have been successfully conducted before the educational program’s launch 18) 26 students with disabilities and 40 students without disabilities have been split into 6 groups in September – 2 one year groups and 4 six-month groups -Inclusive Educational program was piloted with the first cohort of students -26 individual-development plans have been prepared -New cohort of students – 19 students with disabilities and 30 students without disabilities has started the program 19) the first cohort of students has participated at the trainings on communication skills, presentation skills, project management, independent life skills and others.

1) To pilot and revise the joint action plan reflecting the roles and responsibilities of all stakeholders 2) To pilot 6-month and one year curricula on Pottery and Decorative solution and one-year curriculum on Woodworking 3) To pilot two 6-month curricula on simple souvenirs 4) To run training program for creation of inclusive environment 5) To distribute booklets on inclusive education among students 6) To develop Individual –Development Plan (IDP) Template 7) To purchase necessary supplies for inclusive vocational program 8) To organize observations and monitoring of classrooms activities 9) To write recommendation report 10) To enrol second cohort students with and without disabilities 11) To organize trainings for teachers, teacher assistants and special services providers 12) Split of beneficiaries into 3 new inclusive groups and start of educational program 13) To organize additional skills trainings for beneficiaries of the project 14) Business plans of students with disabilities are submitted

1) The roles and responsibilities of all stakeholders were reflected and approved in joint action plan. In addition, three-side letter of intent was signed in November 2020 between UNDP, ASHARI and the State Agency on Vocational Education (SAVE) on the transition of inclusive training centre from Old city to art focused vocational school for the sustainability of inclusive programs. 2) - The pilot of 6-month and one-year curricula and teaching programs on Pottery and decorative solutions and one –year curriculum and teaching modules on Woodcrafts were continued in 2020 with 3 inclusive groups - Starting from March 2020, the teaching process was transformed into video format due to COVID-19 outbreak 3) - The pilot of two 6-month curricula on making simple souvenirs of beads and polymer clay, stained glass and batik was continued with three inclusive groups - Starting from March 2020, the teaching process was transformed into video format due to COVID-19 outbreak 4) - The training program contributing to creation of inclusive environment in the classroom was implemented by the psychologist with four new groups joining in 2020 5) - The booklets were distributed among the second cohort of students enrolled in February 2020 6) - IDP template was piloted with the first and second cohorts of students with disabilities – 46 students 7) - Additional supplies and materials were purchased and home-delivered to students to continue education in home settings via video lessons 8) - Two curriculum experts held classroom observations and monitoring of classroom activities 9) - Two curriculum experts have submitted monitoring reports with recommendations 10) - 19 students with disabilities and 23 students without disabilities started their participation in program in February 2020 11) Last training session on HSE guidelines was conducted in February 2020 12) 19 students with disabilities and 23 students without disabilities enrolled in January 2020 have been split into 3 groups and started their educational group in February 2020 -Inclusive Educational program’s pilot was successfully completed in November 2020. From March-2020-June2020 classes were continued in video format. -46 individual-development plans have been developed, piloted and finalized for all beneficiaries with disabilities -Rehabilitation services were conducted for 46 students with disabilities in classroom settings and in online format during quarantine regime. 13) -all planned additional skills trainings were completed by the end of November 2020. Some training sessions were implemented in video format due to quarantine regime 14) -20 students with disabilities submitted their business plans
